title: Perm Banned after 1 report help please?
body:
"Your account has received a permanent suspension following an extensive audit of in-game behavior within recent League of Legends matches."

So I was recently suspended from League for being "toxic", I accepted this suspension as they proved their reasoning behind the suspension. However after recovering from the suspension I have had no reports against my name, bar one game where I was merely defending myself from the beratement of my entire team for having a bad game of such. Consequently they all reported me resulting in my permanent ban?

How is this fair at all? The proof which riot display is that one and only chat audit where even then is not merely as harsh as I have seen other players speak in this community ( I was defending myself from 3 of my teammates )

Please can I have some further review into my account, as I deem this to be extremely unfair. This is clearly not an "extensive audit" of ingame behavior (1 game).

replies.body:
Punishment has 4 tiers, and are typically administered in order;
10 game chat restriction
25 game chat restriction
14 day account ban
Permanent account ban
Except in extreme cases such as hate speech and death threats, you'll get them one at a time in order. It takes 3 months for your next punishment tier to drop down one.

Retaliation is not a course of action the system deems appropriate. It judges your behaviour when considering your punishment, and only yours.

What this means is that the system has determined that you have not rectified your behaviour from previous punishments and thus have reached the 4th tier. Your account will not be unsuspended for ANY reason other than the punishment being made in error. The severity of the behaviour does not determine the severity of the punishment, the consistency does. 

Basically, you haven't been perma banned for one report, but rather you have perma banned for three previous serious offenses and that last game triggered the 4th tier punishment.

If you believe the ban was made in error, then you can submit the chat logs found in your reform card here and we can look into it for you.
How does the system work for feeders then? Is it the same chat restrictions up until ban?? Because that makes no sense to me.

> [{quoted}](name=Volcanuz,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-02-21T17:10:43.650+0000)
>
> How does the system work for feeders then? Is it the same chat restrictions up until ban?? Because that makes no sense to me.

Great question! Intentional Feeding detection is also under the Instant Feedback system, although it does use a few other metrics and may be manually reviewed as well in some cases. If the Intentional Feeding system is triggered and finds a player is in fact intentionally feeding, the player will be either two-week or permanently suspended. There were a few cases of this occurring a few weeks back during the IP multiplier week, and you can check out a few of the reasonings behind these escalations on those posts: 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/PHEolvpc-permabanned-for-griefing-without-any-prior-bans?comment=0003
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/bBRIzNnn-i-was-banned-lyte-please-help?comment=0004

Let me know if anything's unclear or if you have any additional questions!
So it is just a instant perma ban when it finally kicks in? Cool and also terrifying if you have a bad game and enemy and your team report you.

really? seems there are alot bans going around for 1 bad game. Its even worse when you say like 3 things because a group of premades are being utterpricks for no reason... then they have the gall to tell the enemy team a load of bs, then they believe it because its 3v1 and naturally, people would believe the 3 premade or not, so that entitles 6 reports. Then a 14 day bad is issued for a first offence where all you said was "fuck me, I pressed the wrong button." "piss off, stop attacking me unjustly" and "Get the fuck lost, what the hell did i do you all of you to be be such shits" Enter the unjust ban from harassment. Simply gave up on this game if that would justify as a ban, even if it is only 14 day, completely irrational. So I just roam the boards and either help or banter with people. And let people know what yasuo really is.

Intent feeders will be escalated to a 14 day ban on first detected offense, but thise cases are handled carefully, you will not be banned just for having a bad game. 

Unlikely as it is, if a ban is made in error for something like that you can appeal it through the support system and have it revoked.

Yeah i know you won't get banned for one bad game otherwise id of seen a ban already. 

But it still scares me if you have 4-5 bad games in maybe a week you could be banned for it...  Very scary. Even if you can appeal it. This community scares me, and the OCE is a much better community too from what i remember of the USW community.

I wouldn't worry too much about it, the system and anyone who looks at the reports are pretty good at determining what's intentional and what isn't (and chat logs give away a lot about a game). 

Getting reported even by 5 people doesn't mean you will be punished, it just means 5 people reported you, if those reports are invalid they'll be thrown out.

So try not to worry about it :) It's usually VERY obvious when someone is intent feeding, so you are in very little danger even if you have 10 really bad games in a week.

Yeah i didnt know someone reveiwed them! I thought it was automated. Nice.

I wish i could get a job doing that. As in determining the bans and stuff. I love to read and i can be rather good at picking out the bads. 

Also i just need a job! Lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-02-20T03:49:21.814+0000)**The severity of the behaviour does not determine the severity of the punishment, the consistency does. **

Do you realise how utterly moronic that is?  This method of punishment is frighteningly similar to mandatory sentencing, and if you can't see the error in that then you have been hopelessly brainwashed by the Riot machine.

In severe cases they will skip steps, but as far as your every day toxic goes, its a matter of strengthening the punishment that clearly didn't work. If they are punished by the system it is because they deserve it, and you have to be pretty bad for the system to pick you up at the moment.

This isn't, "This person was worse but is getting a lesser punishment" (or visa versa) but rather it is, the initial punishments haven't been effective so they have been hit harder.

If someone finished their 25 game chat restriction and continues to be toxic, then clearly a chat restriction is not enough of a deterrent. If someone gets banned for 14 days and despite the warning given in the reform email that they will receive a perma ban STILL continue to demonstrate unacceptable behaviour, then clearly they show no desire whatsoever to even consider reforming.

I'll try to give an accurate metaphor here.

Someone breaks into a store and yells at all the employees and the customers, trashing a few things. The store kicks him out but doesn't press charges because it's an isolated incident. 
It happens again, they kick him out and press for reparations for the damage done.
It happens a third time, they prevent him entry to the store, getting security heavily involved. It doesn't happen for a while.
Then once more it happens and they press charges, that someone gets imprisoned.

That someone will get released and may go create a new account and continue causing problems, but he'll just be picked up quicker next time, and he now has a bad reputation.

The escalating punishments isn't about punishing people who don't deserve it, or people who aren't bad enough to be punished, because those people won't be punished. If the transgression is not deserving of a chat ban they won't receive one. If Riot took your stance then there would be no warnings, you would face a perma ban after first offense, not fourth. The four tiers are to give warning and ample chance to reform.

I think you're looking at this from the wrong perspective. You seem to be treating this as if those banned by the system are innocent, or only guilty of the occasional swear or angry comment, but this is just not the case. These are people who have demonstrated that they have no regard for the other people they play with and will be toxic if it suits their own ends or makes them feel better.

You singled out that quote, but I would like to point out what I said below it.

> Again, the severity is only relevant **_to the point where it triggers the system_** (except in special cases such as hate speech), it is the frequency that results in higher punishment tiers.

Your behaviour has to be severe enough for the system to pick you up in the first place. This isn't giving people life jail sentences for petty theft.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2016-02-25T02:22:46.896+0000)
 
> Your behaviour has to be severe enough for the system to pick you up in the first place. This isn't giving people life jail sentences for petty theft.

Well in a way it is, and this guy's chat log is proof of that.  Would you seriously look at that chat log and say that he needs to lose his account over it?  Especially when he's obviously being antagonised?

On that note, why do you expect people to be robots?  Let's assume the poster is telling the truth: do you know what playing with an insanely toxic and trolling 4-man dynamic queue group is like?  

It's incredibly easy to lose your shit if your entire team is purposefully and intentionally ruining your game, and then, once they get that reaction out of you, they report you.  Let's say someone consistently gets dynamic queued with a group of dickheads three times in a day (which I've had happen more times than I can remember) - if they've already had the 14-day suspension and they're trying their hardest to get better, but then they have a bad day like this, they're going to get permabanned, even though they've been provoked and antagonised into an angry response and even though their response **_might not be that bad_**.  All they have to do is slip up ONCE in that game and it's enough to justify the dynamic trolls' report against that person and they get banned. 

Ultimately this results in punishing the victim.  Sure, you could say, yep, you've been bad, you've been toxic enough to get the 3rd warning, but like you said, it's about consistency, not about severity (which is fundamentally absurd) so they go on to _get punished for their behaviour in the absence of context._  

I'm going to be really clear here:  some people deserve to be permabanned because they are insanely toxic, but your method, process and lack of consideration for circumstances is unintelligent.

> Well in a way it is...

But he has done this before. This is the fourth time (that the system has detected) that he has demonstrated behaviour that is far from ok. It doesn't matter if he was antagonised or not. Just because someone else does something doesn't mean it's ok for you too. If someone steals from a supermarket, it's still a crime if you do it after he does, or if someone tells you to do it. So yes, his behaviour is worthy of a perma ban.

> On that note, why do you expect people to be robots?...

I don't, and of course I know what it's like to be victim to the worst of the worst. Believe me I know. There are games where I have gotten so mad at someone that I can barely play the game anymore. 

BUT the difference is that I know how to step away, to take a deep breath and to mute/ignore and move on, and if I can't do that, I know how to not take it out in game. I might complain in skype, I might get frustrated and aggressively cuddle my cat, but I don't take any of that salt and toxicity in to game. 

On the rare occasions it does make it into game, it isn't anywhere near consistent enough to be picked up by the system, it happens maybe once a year. He got banned because he was consistently toxic, you're saying that every one of those games he was antagonised to the point of this level of toxicity? It's usually more than one game that triggers your first punishment. Antagonised or not he told someone they were stupid and worthless, his abuse was targeted and direct. Respect for him coming to the boards to help instead of to complain, he did the right thing there, but his behaviour was clearly in the wrong and it's his decision to reform or not.

> It's incredibly easy to lose your shit...

But don't take it into game. Scream at your screen, throw a book across the room whatever, but don't take out your frustration on PEOPLE. Again, just because they do it, doesn't make it ok.

> Ultimately this results in punishing the victim...

But he has made himself a culprit as well. He isn't being punished for being abused or being a victim, he is being punished for abusing.

> I'm going to be really clear here: some people deserve to be permabanned because they are insanely toxic, but your method, process and lack of consideration for circumstances is unintelligent.

What makes you think there is a lack of consideration? Don't get me wrong, I'm genuinely curious. Every system has it's flaws, but in my eyes everything that needed to be was considered. 

Did he demonstrate verbal abuse? Yes. 
Has he done so in the past? Yes. 
Has he proven that he took no warnings to heart and did nothing to move towards reforming, despite being warned at his 14 day that his next punishment would be a perma ban? Yes. 

I think he deserves the perma here, and that he was given ample warning and reasoning. If he creates a new account I hope he takes it to heart. I'm not too sure what circumstances aren't being considered here. You are responsible for YOUR behaviour and yours alone when you are in game or in client, and he is being punished for it.

I know I shouldn't have said anything, it's just in the overall view I don't believe I should receive a permanent ban for one game after my previous bans. As it says "extensive" proof, where they only show 1 chat audit. Like come on...

Where abouts can I submit the appeal card?

You should have received some chat logs, would you mind posting them so we can have a discussion about it?

If you want to appeal, player support is your best bet - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/

This is the only "in gamer audit" I was sent in regards to my ban.

~~~~~

Your behavior means you are no longer welcome in the League of Legends community.

Unfortunately, you have demonstrated targeted **Verbal Abuse** here, especially towards the end of the log, and as such this is a reportable/punishable offense. It may be less severe than others, but the fact that this is your fourth offense is why you are facing the perma ban. Given the nature of your responses, it is likely the others involved would face punishments as well.

You have a few options from here. If you still wish to appeal the ban, then you can [submit a support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), but I wouldn't get your hopes up.

Otherwise you can create a new account, but understand that the punishments are quicker for newer accounts, so if you continue to demonstrate this kind of behaviour you will face those punishment tiers again very quickly.

Let's be real here. If the entire chat log was to be reviewed everyone in that game would be banned? This system is clearly corrupted, how can I compete against a 3 man dynamic que which continuously berates and pings me the entire game. I mute them and they start trolling, there is no win for me. They make it so.

Engaging that kind of behaviour will always make it worse, so muting/reporting is still your best bet. You're right in that there is no win for you in such a scenario, but you can still make it less of a loss. If you had muted and not engaged then you wouldn't have faced punishment for that game. 

Again, the severity is only relevant to the point where it triggers the system (except in special cases such as hate speech), it is the frequency that results in higher punishment tiers.

You are not expected to compete with them, rather by retaliating, and demonstrating negative behaviour yourself, and having a history of it, the system has punished you for it. 

In game you can only control YOUR actions, not the actions of others, and you are also only responsible for your own actions. If you had said nothing, then even if they had reported you their reports would have been marked as invalid, and you would have faced no punishment for this game.

Understand that the system treats every player's behaviour separately. It does not matter if you were responding to someone else, if you demonstrate negative/toxic behaviour you will face punishments for it, just as anyone else will.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-20T05:24:51.507+0000)
>
> Engaging that kind of behaviour will always make it worse, so muting/reporting is still your best bet. You're right in that there is no win for you in such a scenario, but you can still make it less of a loss. If you had muted and not engaged then you wouldn't have faced punishment for that game. 

Muting is unacceptable, as it deprives you of the ability to report in the first place, among other things. Sorry, but that doesn't stand up as a policy to deal with it.

It's not supposed to. Muting is in place to protect players from further toxicity. It is not designed to solve any problems, only to lessen the consequences. It isn't sufficient as a standalone barrier because it isn't meant to exist on it's own.

The alternative is to not have a mute option, which still doesn't solve the problems and makes things worse for the people that mute does help.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-11T08:57:09.272+0000)
>
> It's not supposed to. Muting is in place to protect players from further toxicity. It is not designed to solve any problems, only to lessen the consequences. 

It can actually increase the consequences because the player will be unaware of any slander etc. afterward against them. Without mute the player can at least respond to the slander to make it clear that it's a lie. 

> The alternative is to not have a mute option, which still doesn't solve the problems and makes things worse for the people that mute does help.

Repetition of the above point. You are forced to not mute if you want to deal with slander that influences other players.

But does responding to it make it clear that it's a lie? Often responding in the negative only convinces the slandering party further, and given it's a game of League, and these are strangers we are talking about, what can they say that would be true? Maybe they get lucky but they have no way of knowing anything unless you tell them. Responding to slander still makes it worse.

How does it influence other players exactly? In my experience if someone is going off at someone else, it's not the someone else that the other players have a low opinion of, it's the one going off at them. Why would they take the word of a toxic ass? They aren't exactly very convincing. 

Even if the slander is something like "this shit jng never ganked" well if he ganked the other lanes, they'll know that's a lie, and if he didn't then it's not a lie, and if he has a valid reason (got invaded or whatevs) then they'll know that as well. The only reportable behaviour there is the one hating on the jungler. Being bad at the game is not reportable.

> Muting is unacceptable, as it deprives you of the ability to report in the first place

This especially confuses me, how does it stop you from reporting them? If someone is toxic, and therefore you have muted them, is that not grounds to report them? Muting someone doesn't stop you from reporting them in any way. 

If you are the kind or person who mutes all at the start of each game then you are not in any danger from verbal toxicity to begin with, so even if they are toxic they can't ruin your game.

Perhaps I'm missing some perspective here but I really don't see how muting can make toxicity worse. It may not be effective for stopping it entirely, but it doesn't make it worse.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2ovMvbyb,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T10:18:15.227+0000)
>
> 
> Perhaps I'm missing some perspective here but I really don't see how muting can make toxicity worse. It may not be effective for stopping it entirely, but it doesn't make it worse.

You are, don't you worry about that. I also noticed a lot of fallacies in some of your other posts that I will let lie for the moment.

If you notice something I have said on which I am mistaken please let me know, I'm hardly infallible and have to find most of the sources myself. I always try to give an official source for info I give to people, but I'd appreciate you pointing me to some of these fallacies so I can correct them if necessary.

I'm trying to be helpful here and I can't understand your perspective if you don't give me something to go off, so I'd really appreciate that insight. It's pretty clear you're disillusioned with Riot for one reason or another (or many) but maybe I can give you their perspective in this.

Rito still replies some "clever" ideas such as "mute them, dont flame them ((because you will be banned and they will get away with trolling every game cause our system only bans those who writes ANYTHING in chat, not trolls" but you cant really defend yourself by muting someone who is intentionally ruining your game. Muting them doesnt make it better. Also i would like to add this screenshot for what I god banned for 14 days, after that I realized Riot is not worth my time nor money anymore, since I have never been rude to anyone who was trying to win a game, I just get tilted by trolls who are trying to lose on purpose and they replied to me something like that I have been SARCASTIC AND THATS PUNISHABLE NEGATIVE BEHAVIOR---- yes, so are you sarcastinc? enjoy your ban! 

your non-functioning tribunal system will doom you, you are losing good players while you are protecting trolls who are in most games lately, just becuase they can. without any punishment.
http://s18.postimg.org/ykvfeatq1/ban_for_easy_for_14_day.png

http://s18.postimg.org/i1mju9j3t/sarcasm_bannable.png
